goal.title: A stable and prosperous economy, encouraging trade, investment and providing economic opportunities for all members of society throughout Vanuatu

indicators.title: ECO 1.1.1 Change in underlying inflation rate (CPI analysis)
ECO 1.1.2 GDP Growth Rate (annual/trends)
ECO 1.2.1 Change in government revenue (GFS Tables)
ECO 1.3.1 Change in national budget position (deficit/surplus) (GFS Tables)
ECO 1.3.2 Debt ratio to GDP (inclusive of SOE generated debt)
ECO 1.4.1 Value and volume of national trade/merchandise trade
ECO 1.4.2 Current Accounts balance change
ECO 1.5.1 Benefits/value accrued through various trade agreements
ECO 1.5.2 Trade by trade agreement (value)
ECO 1.5.3 Balance of trade by major partner countries
ECO 1.6.1 Trade agreement analysis reports
ECO 1.6.2 Total estimated value of trade agreement as proportion of GDP
ECO 1.7.1 Level of production of major commodities to include cocoa and copra
ECO 1.7.2 Change in volume of business licenses issued to Ni-Vanuatu
ECO 1.8.1 Total number of new users of financial services annual, acknowledging pop growth (number accounts opening/year)
ECO 1.8.2 Interest Rate level (average bank rate)
ECO 1.8.3 Deposit ratios
ECO 1.9.1 Proportion of population with an understanding of very basic principles of personal financial accounting
ECO 2.1.1 Proportion of households sourcing energy for lighting from renewable sources
ECO 2.1.2 Total number of mini-grid renewable energy systems in rural communities by province
ECO 2.2.1 Proportion of population with reliable access to safe drinking water
ECO 2.2.2 Proportion of population with reliable access to improved sanitation facilities
ECO 2.3.1 Proportion of new buildings in compliance with the building code
ECO 2.3.2 Proportion of existing buildings repaired in compliance with the building code
ECO 2.4.1 Proportion of established road and building standards implemented
ECO 2.5.1 Variance from approved asset management budget
ECO 2.6.1 Proportion of population with access to transport by road, sea and air
ECO 2.7.1 Total number of external audits undertaken to establish compliance with conventions and standards and expose non-conformity
ECO 2.8.1 Proportion of procurement contracts issued for Island Based Contractors, Community Based Contractors
ECO 2.9.1 % of population having access to broadband connection
ECO 2.9.2 Annual change in total number of users of on-line government services
ECO 3.1.1 Total annual value of tourism industry, infrastructure, agricultural production and industry as a proportion of GDP
ECO 3.1.2 Number of businesses participating in the annual agri-tourism festival by sector
ECO 3.2.1 Average annual household income from tourism
ECO 3.2.2.Annual change in tourism by air and sea arrivals
ECO 3.2.3 Proportion of visitors traveling to outer islands
ECO 3.3.1 Rate of Return to investments in rural infrastructure
ECO 3.3.2 Capacity utilisation rate: Manufacturing
ECO 3.3.3 Total number of standard operational storage and processing facilities located in rural areas by province
ECO 3.4.1 Total annual number of agricultural extension services per capita by province
ECO 3.4.2 Total number of rural producer cooperatives registered by province
ECO 3.5.1 Total annual number of rural economic analysis reports published
ECO 3.6.1 Average traveling distance to nearest school, health facility, police post by province
ECO 3.6.2 Number of controlled waste disposal facilities
ECO 4.1.1 Growth in Gross Fixed Capital Formation
ECO 4.2.1 Proportion of rural households engaged in trade with family in urban centres
ECO 4.3.1 Total number of processed local products produced per annum for domestic consumption and export
ECO4.3.2 Ratio of processed export commodities (including coconut, kava, cocoa, coffee) to raw exports
ECO 4.4.1 Proportion of registered hospitality institutions with rooms and services equipped with energy efficient lighting and appliances
ECO 4.5.1 Employment cost index (ECI)
ECO 4.6.1 Labour force participation by sector
ECO 4.6.2 Total annual number of validated complaints registered with Labour Union
ECO 4.7.1 Change in total number of individuals participating in seasonal work programmes
ECO 4.7.2 Labour market flows
ECO 4.7.3 Total annual remittances as a proportion of GDP
ECO 4.8.1 Total annual number of new businesses registered by type
ECO 4.9.1 Total number of public/private joint ventures in operation

goal.title: A nation that ensures our food and nutrition security needs are adequately met for all people through increasing sustainable food production systems and improving household production

indicators.title: ENV 1.1.1 Proportion of households engaged in production of food for own consumption
ENV 1.1.2 Up to date data on primary production (agriculture, livestock, forestry, fisheries, biosecurity) available for analysis and informed decision-making and reporting
ENV 1.1.3 Average incidence of food poverty at the household level (Food Poverty Line)
ENV 1.2.1 National food guidelines directing food security and nutrition promotional activities (including aelan kaikai) completed and operational
ENV 1.3.1 Total annual volume of imports of food and products targeted by DARD as those that can be produced domestically (including ‘value-added products)
ENV 1.3.2 Domestic food price level

ENV 1.3.3 Food Price Inflation Rate or Food Price Index compared to the national consumer price index (how much are prices for food going up or down, relative to all prices in the country-based on VNSO data)
ENV 1.4.1Total FADs per 1,000 population by province
ENV 1.4.2 Total number of people receiving training in food storage and preservation per year in MALFFB led, NGO or partnered initiatives
ENV 1.4.3 Establishment of land use capability mapping systems to determine which crops and farming systems are best suited to different areas
ENV 1.5.1 Proportion of producers across the productive sector that have undergone Agro-Met training
ENV 1.5.2 Crop diversity index with a focus on fruit and vegetables (average number of varieties planted of crops by province)
ENV 1.5.3 Proportion of farmers involved in integrated farming practices
ENV 2.1.1 Proportion of 'blue-green growth friendly' national policies fully implemented
ENV 2.2.1 Number of development projects complying with EIA requirements
ENV 2.2.2 No. of environmental guidelines developed
ENV 2.3.1 Proportion of all imported lighting and refrigeration appliances that meet high energy efficiency standards
ENV 2.3.2 Proportion of households using renewable energy technology as main source of lighting
ENV 2.3.3 Percentage of grid-based electricity generated from renewable energy sources
ENV 2.4.1 Number of controlled wasted disposal facilities
ENV 2.4.2 Proportion of vehicles that comply with emission standards
ENV 2.4.3 Proportion of revised National Waste Management Strategy and Action Plan implemented
ENV 2.5.1 Proportion of targets met in National Environment Policy and Implementation Plan 2016-2030
ENV 2.5.2 Proportion of environmental obligations within international conventions and treaties met
ENV 2.6.1 Proportion of funding requested by DEPC in support of sustainable development approved through NPP/percentage of government expenditure for environmental activities
ENV 2.6.2 Amount deposited in the Environmental Trust Fund
ENV 3.1.1 Proportion of government ministries with policies, budgets, and legislation for CC & DRM
ENV 3.1.2 Institutional strengthening of NAB, Department of Climate Change and other MoCC departments
ENV 3.1.3 Alignment of sector stakeholders’ programs and CC & DRM policies and legislation
ENV 3.2.1 Establishment of multi-hazard warning systems with maintenance plans in place
ENV 3.2.2 Proportion of population with access to technologies that convey early warnings
ENV 3.2.3  Increased knowledge and scientific research in atmospheric and earth sciences
ENV 3.3.1 Number of support plans available to communities for coordination, planning, preparedness, response and recovery
ENV 3.3.2 Percentage of climate change and disaster affected communities with durable solutions
ENV 3.3.3 Number of multi-hazard and risk maps to improve Post-Disaster Needs Assessment
ENV 3.4.1 Percentage of public schools using the climate change and disaster risk reduction modules in national curriculum at all levels
ENV 3.4.2 Number of communication and partnership activities and awareness programs established targeting issues such as climate change adaptation and resilience
ENV 3.5.1 Proportion of annual spending on climate change adaptation and disaster risk management funded with budget support from donor partners to the government
ENV 3.5.2 Number of climate and disaster finance funds to which Vanuatu is formally accredited
ENV 3.5.3 Amount of climate and disaster finance used for community programs and activities through external support
ENV 4.1.1 Proportion of declared physical planning areas that have a physical plan
ENV 4.1.2  Proportion of directives of the national land use planning policy implemented
ENV 4.2.1 Number of declared Water Protection Zones
ENV 4.2.2 Establishment of GIS mapping relevant to the management of forest activities
ENV 4.3.1 Proportion of extraction activities complying with EIA requirements
ENV 4.4.1 Level of compliance by Vanuatu with respect to its national fishing fleet within the Regional Fisheries Management Organisations
ENV 4.4.2 Number of integrated coastal management plans developed and implemented
ENV 4.5.1 Total number of approved Fisheries Management Plans for designated fisheries
ENV 4.5.2 Number of commercial sand mines
ENV 4.5.3 Number of places where detailed geo-scientific information has been collected
ENV 4.6.1 Annual estimated area (square km) of reforestation and rehabilitation
ENV 4.6.2 Proportion of licensees harvesting within their allocated quota or Proportion of licensee operations being monitored
ENV 4.7.1 Total annual outreach and awareness activities undertaken by or in partnership with the DEPC
ENV 5.1.1 Proportion of NBSAP and NISSAP targets met
ENV 5.1.2 Total number of environmental guidelines in place
ENV 5.2.1 Total number of registered CCAs
ENV 5.2.2 Proportion of community management committees implementing their CCA management plan
ENV 5.3.1 Proportion of population with knowledge of the names of local flora and fauna
ENV 5.3.2 Number of threatened species legally protected
ENV 5.4.1 Proportion of incoming planes and sea vessels cleared through Biosecurity annually
ENV 5.5.1 Number of model schools implementing environmental programmes
ENV 5.6.1 Proportion of government agencies using a central information sharing system for environment data

goal.title: A Nation based on traditional governance and Christian principles, which underpin our culture and continue to bestow life skills and knowledge to future generations

indicators.title: SOC 1.1.1 Proportion of population speaking indigenous language daily
SOC 1.1.2 Proportion of population first language learned indigenous
SOC 1.1.3 Proportion of endangered languages documented
SOC 1.2.1 Proportion of population with knowledge of traditional stories, dances, songs, and games
SOC 1.2.2 Proportion of population possessing common and basic traditional production skills related to weaving, transport, housing, farming, food preparation
SOC 1.2.3 Proportion of population with ability to 1: produce herbal medicines, and 2: massage
SOC 1.3.1 Total number of sites with cultural and/or historical significance newly identified, registered and preserved
SOC 1.4.1 Proportion of bills that are reviewed by MCC prior to parliamentary debate
SOC 1.5.1 Proportion of national formal and informal educational institutions and health facilities with religious affiliation and support
SOC 1.6.1 Proportion of public schools using the culture and heritage modules in national curriculum at all levels
SOC 1.6.2 Proportion of cultural heritage materials in the national curriculum at all levels
SOC 1.7.1 Proportion of population with free access to traditional lands, forest and marine resources
SOC 1.7.2 Proportion of population that use traditional lands for agriculture, marine, forestry and livestock for consumption or customary purposes
SOC 2.1.1 Percentage of age 6 in Yr. 1 who attended kindergarten
SOC 2.2.1 Percentage of schools demonstrating effective implementation and management of school grants
SOC 2.3.1 Percentage of students meeting literacy and numeracy standards
SOC 2.4.1 No. of technical and vocational schools that are certified and registered under the Vanuatu Qualifications Authority to operate
SOC 3.1.1 Number of skilled health professionals to 10,000 population
SOC 3.1.2 Maternal mortality ratio/Number of maternal deaths
SOC 3.1.3 Percentage of fully functional HFs according to Role Delineation Policy
SOC 3.2.1 No. of Diabetic (NCD) related amputations
SOC 3.2.2 Incidence of TB (per 100,000 population)
SOC 3.2.3 Malaria annual parasite incidence rate
SOC 3.3.1 Diphtheria tetanus toxoid and pertussis (DTP3) immunisation coverage among 1 year olds (%)
SOC 3.3.2 Prevalence of obesity in adult population
SOC 3.3.3 Under 5 mortality rate
SOC 3.4.1 Percentage of units with current strategic plans in place that link with Health Sector Strategy
SOC 3.4.2 Percentage of Corporate positions within MoH filled on permanent basis
SOC 3.4.3 Percentage of attributes attained based on International Health Regulation Index (IHR) Component 2
SOC 4.1.1 Proportion of  government departments with gender responsive policies, legislation and programs
SOC 4.1.2 Number of decisions in which women participate
SOC 4.1.3 Indicators of women’s empowerment
SOC 4.2.1 Subjective Well-being indicator
SOC 4.2.2 Number of reported cases of violence against women, children, and vulnerable people
SOC 4.2.3 Percentage of reported cases of violence against women, children, and vulnerable people addressed
SOC 4.3.1 Proportion of population reporting some degree of disability
SOC 4.3.2 Percentage of public buildings and banking, employment and recreational facilities allowing access for people with disabilities
SOC 4.3.3 Percentage of all political, community and government leadership positions have people with disability represented
SOC 4.4.1 Proportion of the activities of the  National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) implemented
SOC 4.4.2 Proportion of human rights related conventions ratified
SOC 4.4.3 Proportion of laws reviewed on basis of discriminatory and gender biased principles
SOC 4.5.1 Proportion of Government Offices and public facilities with ramp access or some disability friendly rating

SOC 4.6.1 Total number of cases with children experiencing human rights violations in the following areas sexual abuse, neglect, physical abuse, exploitation, emotional abuse (disseminate by these areas) accessing support services
SOC 4.6.2 Proportion of youth age 14 -30 that feel valued in society
SOC 4.7.1 Proportion of youth actively participating in at least one organised sport in the last 12 months by gender
SOC 4.7.2 Number of government sponsored or partnered sporting events in the last 12 months
SOC 5.1.1 Proportion of Justice and Community Services Sector Capacity Development Strategy 2017-2020 implemented
SOC 5.1.2 Annual change in number of Magistrate and Supreme Court pending cases
SOC 5.1.3 Average cost of legal fees/services for a court case
SOC 5.2.1 Number of Anti-Corruption committee submissions acted upon
SOC 5.3.1 Annual number of community safety assessments carried out by VPF
SOC 5.3.2 Total number of national security forces per 1,000 population
SOC 5.3.3 Total number of correctional officers per 100 detainees
SOC 5.4.1 Annual number of patrol missions within EEZ
SOC 5.4.2 Percentage of licensed vessels which have trained observers on board
SOC 5.4.3 Level of reporting to the Vessel Monitoring System (VMS)
SOC 5.5.1 Total number of annual community engagement activities undertaken by national law enforcement officers
SOC 5.5.2 Incidents of theft and vandalism reported annually to the police (and the proportion of reported incidents to unreported)
SOC 5.5.3 Proportion of population with positive assessment of their chief's ability to resolve disputes peacefully
SOC 6.1.1 Reduction in annual Employment Disciplinary Board decisions
SOC 6.1.2 Annual number of public officials receiving relevant qualifications through VIPAM and other government programs
SOC 6.1.3 Reduction in level of subsidies/grants to SOEs
SOC 6.2.1 Proportion of SOEs and Statutory bodies submitting annual reports to their boards of directors
SOC 6.3.1 Proportion of eligible population reporting to have voted in last election
SOC 6.3.2 Proportion of population with an overall positive assessment of their local elected officials
SOC 6.3.3 Number of MPs submitting annual financial accountability report
SOC 6.4.1 Proportion of BP objectives met as reported in department ARs
SOC 6.5.1 Change in annual budget going to Provinces, Municipalities towards operations/programs (Devolution of funding authority)
SOD 6.5.2 Proportion of provinces with up-to-date three year “rolling” plans submitted to DLA
SOD 6.6.1 Proportion of declared physical planning areas that have a physical plan
SOC 6.7.1 Proportion of population utilising media outlets for news including: newspapers, mobile phones, radio, television, and internet
SOC 6.7.2 Proportion of data collected from requests acted upon by RTI officers in each government agency
SOC 6.8.1 Percentage of aid the government sector reported on the government’s budget
SOC 6.8.2 Percentage of aid for the government sector using Vanuatu government PFM systems
SOC 6.8.3 Percentage of aid for the government sector using Vanuatu government procurement systems
SOC 6.9.1 NSDP data reviewed annually
SOC 6.9.2 Percentage of NSDS strategic objectives achieved
